lead_paragraph: In a matchup of world champions, it was a 14-year-old newcomer who stole the spotlight at Skate America in Reading, Pa. While the 2006 world winner Kimmie Meissner was beating the current world champion Miki Ando in the short program last night, the junior high schooler Caroline Zhang impressed in her debut as a senior skater. From her opening triple flip-triple toe loop combination to an incredible finish, Zhang was mesmerizing and finished third. “I’m really happy with how I skated today,” said Zhang, the world junior champion. “It could have been better: I didn’t hold the combination spin enough and I could’ve performed better.” On the men’s side, Japan’s Daisuke Takahashi was outpointed in the free skate by Evan Lysacek, the United States champion, yet he still won the overall competition thanks to his overwhelming margin from the short program.
